channel.title: Dining on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Dining on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: We Are All Made Of Stars
item.description: Honestly, it makes no sense why a company best known for manufacturing tires is such an important voice in the world of fine dining, but Michelin has embraced its gastronomic role with gusto for more than a century. Now, it turns out that one of its most-decorated chefs isn’t feeling that gusto himself. Sébastien Bras, a French chef whose restaurant Le Suquet has been a three-star mainstay of the Michelin guide for close to two decades, made the first-ever request to be removed from the guide without a significant change to his model.
